hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Shock Echo - Volatility Spike on Low Volume Rally
hypothesis_content.statement: In the current NEUTRAL regime, a rapid 5%+ price increase in BTC over 48 hours on declining or flat spot volume (below 30-day median) will be unsustainable and result in a sharp intra-week reversal capturing > 60% of the initial move.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Post 'October liquidity crash,' the market lacks deep, organic liquidity. A low-volume rally is indicative of algorithmic or leveraged momentum chasing, not genuine capital inflow. The disparity between price action (up), volume (low), and CVD (weak) shows a fragile move. The surge in OI represents weak hands entering late. This setup is prone to a violent liquidation flush when momentum stalls.
entry_conditions: BTC price increases >= 5% within a 48-hour window
Spot trading volume during the rally is <= the 30-day median volume
Open Interest in perpetuals increases by > 15% during the rally (leveraged chase)
Cumulative Volume Delta (CVD) for the period is flat or negative

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces to 61.8% Fibonacci level of the initial 48-hour rally from its high
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes above the high of the initial 48-hour rally on sustained volume (> 30-day 80th percentile)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days after the entry signal (48hr rally high)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The low-volume rally is followed by a surge in high-quality, high-volume buying (CVD turning strongly positive), indicating stealth accumulation and a genuine trend change, not a liquidity void.
